body.p: The workshop will focus on an in-depth understanding of our body with the help of our movement. During this workshop we will work deeper on breathing, impulse, weight shifting, momentum, spine and geometry. We will also get in touch with Manipur Martial arts “Thang-Ta” to explore movement. The workshop promises to be fun, including choreography and improvisation.

Surjit Nongmeikapam (Bonbon), from Manipur, is a choreographer, dancer, movement teacher and artist-performer. He got his BA in Choreography from Natya Institute of Kathak and Choreography (Bangalore). He is well trained in Indian classical/traditional dance, Indian martial arts, contemporary dance and movement.

He started to work professionally as a dance artist in 2004 and since then he hasn't looked back. He worked as a Dance therapist and led workshops and awareness trainings for trauma victims at “H2H” (Centre for Torture Victims, Imphal, Manipur 2009–2013).
